content: This scenario is highly unlikely. While it is possible that people may not need to own certain things in the future, it is unlikely that everything will be free and available to everyone. This type of system would require a significant overhaul of the current economic and social structures, and it is unclear how it would be sustainable in the long term. Additionally, the lack of privacy that you describe would likely be a major concern for many people. It is important for individuals to have control over their personal belongings and space in order to maintain their autonomy and privacy.
